claim text: As noted here, the main findings of our study are that the concomitant administration of darunavir/ritonavir in HIV-seronegative healthy volunteers caused a marked change in the systemic exposure of rosuvastatin. The geometric mean steady-state Cmax and AUC0–24 h of rosuvastatin increased by an average of 2.4-fold and 1.5-fold, respectively.
participants text: Of 20 participants screened
drug1 dose text: Rosuvastatin was administered once daily at a dose of 10 mg alone for 7 days. After the washout period, a combination of darunavir/ritonavir (600/100 mg twice daily) and rosuvastatin (10 mg once daily) was administered for 7 days.
drug2 dose text: Rosuvastatin was administered once daily at a dose of 10 mg alone for 7 days. After the washout period, a combination of darunavir/ritonavir (600/100 mg twice daily) and rosuvastatin (10 mg once daily) was administered for 7 days.
auc text: Table I.  Pharmacokinetics of Rosuvastatin
cmax text: Table I.  Pharmacokinetics of Rosuvastatin

claim text: In contrast to the observed changes in rosuvastatin pharmacokinetics, there were no significant changes apparent in the steady-state pharmacokinetics of darunavir or ritonavir pharmacokinetics in the presence of steady-state dosing of rosuvastatin
participants text: Of 20 participants screened
drug1 dose text: Rosuvastatin was administered once daily at a dose of 10 mg alone for 7 days. After the washout period, a combination of darunavir/ritonavir (600/100 mg twice daily) and rosuvastatin (10 mg once daily) was administered for 7 days.
drug2 dose text: Rosuvastatin was administered once daily at a dose of 10 mg alone for 7 days. After the washout period, a combination of darunavir/ritonavir (600/100 mg twice daily) and rosuvastatin (10 mg once daily) was administered for 7 days.
auc text: In contrast to the observed changes in rosuvastatin pharmacokinetics, there were no significant changes apparent in the steady-state pharmacokinetics of darunavir or ritonavir pharmacokinetics in the presence of steady-state dosing of rosuvastatin
cmax text: In contrast to the observed changes in rosuvastatin pharmacokinetics, there were no significant changes apparent in the steady-state pharmacokinetics of darunavir or ritonavir pharmacokinetics in the presence of steady-state dosing of rosuvastatin
cl text: In contrast to the observed changes in rosuvastatin pharmacokinetics, there were no significant changes apparent in the steady-state pharmacokinetics of darunavir or ritonavir pharmacokinetics in the presence of steady-state dosing of rosuvastatin
halflife text: In contrast to the observed changes in rosuvastatin pharmacokinetics, there were no significant changes apparent in the steady-state pharmacokinetics of darunavir or ritonavir pharmacokinetics in the presence of steady-state dosing of rosuvastatin

claim text: Compared to treatment with fluvastatin alone, fluvastatin AUC was similar and Cmax increased marginally (15.7%) with concomitant treatment with clopidogrel.
participants text: 30 healthy male volunteers were enrolled to ensure that at least 24 subjects would complete the study.

claim text: Amiodarone increased simvastatin acid AUC (area under the plasma concentration–time curve)0–24 h, peak plasma concentration (Cmax), and t1/2 by 73% (P=0.02), 100% (P=0.02), and 48% (P=0.06), respectively, whereas it did not significantly alter pravastatin pharmacokinetics.
participants text: . Twelve white occidental healthy volunteers (seven male and five female subjects) aged 19–43 years were enrolled in this study.
drug1 dose text: subjects received 400 mg of amiodarone (Cordarone®, 200 mg tablets, Sanofi-Aventis, France) orally each morning for 3 days.
drug2 dose text: the subjects received, after an overnight fast, a single oral dose of pravastatin (Elisor®, 40 mg tablets, Bristol-Myers Squibb, France) or simvastatin (Zocor®, 40 mg tablet, Merck Sharp Dohme-Chibret, France) on days 1 and 4 in a randomized order.
auc text: Amiodarone significantly increased the mean AUC0–24 h of both the parent simvastatin lactone (by 73% P=0.02) and of simvastatin acid (by 78% P=0.02) (Table 1 and Figure 2). The Cmax of simvastatin acid was increased by 100% by amiodarone (P=0.02). Amiodarone had no significant effect on the t1/2 of simvastatin and a borderline effect on the t1/2 of simvastatin acid (P=0.06).Table 1. claim text: With paroxetine pretreatment, the area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) of (+)- and (−)-tramadol was increased (37% [P = .001] and 32% [P = .002], respectively), and the corresponding AUCs of (+)- and (−)-M1 were decreased (67% [P = .0004] and 40% [P = .0008], respectively).
participants text: Fourteen male and 2 female healthy, drug-free (except for oral contraceptives) volunteers aged 20 to 30 years participated.
drug1 dose text: The study had a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, 4-way crossover design. Treatment on the 3 consecutive days before the study days began was 20 mg paroxetine at bedtime (Seroxat tablets; GlaxoSmithKline, London, United Kingdom) or the equivalent placebo.
drug2 dose text: Treatment on the study days was a single oral dose of 150 mg tramadol (50-mg capsules of Nobligan; Grünenthal GmbH, Aachen, Germany) or the equivalent placebo.
auc text: Table I. Areas under plasma concentration-time curves of enantiomers of tramadol and metabolite M1

claim text: Co-administration with clarithromycin significantly increased the primary pharmacokinetic parameters of rivaroxaban (Table 2, Figure 1C). Both the mean AUC and Cmax were significantly increased, by 54% (90% CI 44%, 64%) and 40% (90% CI 30%, 52%), respectively, in comparison with rivaroxaban alone.
participants text: A total of 16 subjects were enrolled into the study, with a mean age of 37.6 years (range 24-50 years) and a mean weight of 81.1 ± 12.0 kg.
drug1 dose text: In a randomized, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg alone, or clarithromycin 500 mg twice daily for a period of 4 days under steady-state conditions,
drug2 dose text: In a randomized, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg alone, or clarithromycin 500 mg twice daily for a period of 4 days under steady-state conditions,
auc text: Co-administration with clarithromycin significantly increased the primary pharmacokinetic parameters of rivaroxaban (Table 2, Figure 1C). Both the mean AUC and Cmax were significantly increased, by 54% (90% CI 44%, 64%) and 40% (90% CI 30%, 52%), respectively, in comparison with rivaroxaban alone.
cmax text: Co-administration with clarithromycin significantly increased the primary pharmacokinetic parameters of rivaroxaban (Table 2, Figure 1C). Both the mean AUC and Cmax were significantly increased, by 54% (90% CI 44%, 64%) and 40% (90% CI 30%, 52%), respectively, in comparison with rivaroxaban alone.
cl text: Co-administration with clarithromycin significantly increased the primary pharmacokinetic parameters of rivaroxaban (Table 2, Figure 1C). Both the mean AUC and Cmax were significantly increased, by 54% (90% CI 44%, 64%) and 40% (90% CI 30%, 52%), respectively, in comparison with rivaroxaban alone.
halflife text: Pharmacokinetic parameters of rivaroxaban (10 mg) administered alone or in combination with ketoconazole 200 mg once daily or 400 mg once daily, ritonavir 600 mg twice daily, clarithromycin 500 mg twice daily, erythromycin 500 mg three times daily or ...

claim text: Co-administration with steady-state erythromycin significantly increased the pharmacokinetics of rivaroxaban (Table 2, Figure 1D). The mean AUC and Cmax both significantly increased (by 34% [90% CI 23%, 46%] and 38% [90% CI 21%, 48%], respectively) compared with rivaroxaban alone.
participants text: A total of 16 subjects were enrolled into the study and were valid for the safety analysis.
drug1 dose text: In an open label, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg alone, or erythromycin 500 mg three times daily given for 4 days, with a single 500 mg dose given on day 5 with rivaroxaban 10 mg.
drug2 dose text: In an open label, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg alone, or erythromycin 500 mg three times daily given for 4 days, with a single 500 mg dose given on day 5 with rivaroxaban 10 mg.

claim text: Upon the coadministration of telaprevir with a single dose of amlodipine-atorvastatin, the atorvastatin AUC0-∞ increased 7.88-fold and the atorvastatin Cmax increased 10.6-fold.
participants text: Twenty-one healthy male (n = 15) and female (n = 6) volunteers were enrolled at the Covance Clinical Research Unit, Inc., Daytona Beach, FL.
drug1 dose text: telaprevir in combination with Caduet tablets containing 5 mg of amlodipine and 20 mg of atorvastatin (amlodipine-atorvastatin). Volunteers received the following treatment: a single dose of amlodipine-atorvastatin alone on day 1, followed by a washout period,
drug2 dose text: Telaprevir (375-mg tablets, Patheon, Mississauga, Ontario, Canada) was administered at 750 mg q8h orally in the fed state (30 min after the start of a meal or snack).
auc text: Based on the ratio of the LS means, the mean Cmax and the AUC0-∞ were markedly increased 10.6-fold and 7.88-fold, respectively, by the coadministration of telaprevir (Table 1).
cmax text: Based on the ratio of the LS means, the mean Cmax and the AUC0-∞ were markedly increased 10.6-fold and 7.88-fold, respectively, by the coadministration of telaprevir (Table 1).
cl text: The mean apparent clearance (CL/F) decreased from 685 liters/h to 83.8 liters/h. The mean (SD) t1/2 decreased from 9.44 (2.64) h to 6.75 (1.55) h with telaprevir coadministration; the difference in t1/2 was not statistically significant.
halflife text: The mean apparent clearance (CL/F) decreased from 685 liters/h to 83.8 liters/h. The mean (SD) t1/2 decreased from 9.44 (2.64) h to 6.75 (1.55) h with telaprevir coadministration; the difference in t1/2 was not statistically significant.

claim text: Nelfinavir increased the steady-state area under the plasma concentration-time curve during one dosing period (AUCτ) of atorvastatin 74% and the maximum concentration (Cmax) of atorvastatin 122% and increased the AUCτ of simvastatin 505% and the Cmax of simvastatin 517%. Neither atorvastatin nor simvastatin appeared to alter the pharmacokinetics of nelfinavir.
participants text: The 32 enrolled subjects consisted of 12 Caucasians (six males and six females), 15 African Americans (eight males and seven females), and five Hispanics (two males and three females).
drug1 dose text: In period 2, subjects received atorvastatin calcium (10 mg QD) plus nelfinavir (Viracept; 1,250 mg twice a day [BID]) for an additional 14 days (days 15 to 28).
drug2 dose text: In period 2, subjects received atorvastatin calcium (10 mg QD) plus nelfinavir (Viracept; 1,250 mg twice a day [BID]) for an additional 14 days (days 15 to 28).
auc text: Pharmacokinetic parameters of atorvastatin and simvastatin
cmax text: Pharmacokinetic parameters of atorvastatin and simvastatin

claim text: The geometric mean (gmean) plasma concentrations of rosuvastatin over time were similar when rosuvastatin was coadministered with ketoconazole and placebo (Figure 1).
participants text: Fourteen male Caucasian volunteers were enrolled
drug1 dose text: Healthy male volunteers (n = 14) received ketoconazole 200 mg or placebo twice daily for 7 days, and rosuvastatin 80 mg was coadministered on day 4 of dosing
drug2 dose text: Healthy male volunteers (n = 14) received ketoconazole 200 mg or placebo twice daily for 7 days, and rosuvastatin 80 mg was coadministered on day 4 of dosing.
auc text: Summary pharmacokinetic parameters of rosuvastatin, and results of the statistical analysis of the plasma AUC(0,t) and Cmax of rosuvastatin, when coadministered with ketoconazole and placebo
cmax text: Summary pharmacokinetic parameters of rosuvastatin, and results of the statistical analysis of the plasma AUC(0,t) and Cmax of rosuvastatin, when coadministered with ketoconazole and placebo

claim text: The concentration–time profiles of both warfarin enantiomers were virtually superimposable in the presence (day 13) or absence (day 1) of ambrisentan. Following multiple doses of ambrisentan, the observed mean AUC0–last values for R-and S-warfarin increased by 4.7% (GMR 104.7; 90% CI 101.7, 107.7) and 1.6% (101.6; 90% CI 98.4, 105.0), respectively, and mean Cmax values decreased for both enantiomers by 8.4% (91.6; 90% CI 86.2, 97.4) and 10.1% (93.0; 90% CI 90.8, 95.3), respectively (Table 1).
participants text: In this open-label cross-over study, 22 healthy subjects received a single dose of racemic warfarin 25 mg alone and after 8 days of ambrisentan 10 mg once daily
drug1 dose text: On days 5 to 16, subjects received a single daily dose of ambrisentan 10 mg (Gilead Sciences, Inc., formerly Myogen, Inc., Westminster, CO, USA).
drug2 dose text: In this open-label cross-over study, 22 healthy subjects received a single dose of racemic warfarin 25 mg alone and after 8 days of ambrisentan 10 mg once daily
auc text: Effect of ambrisentan on R-and S-warfarin pharmacokinetics
cmax text: Effect of ambrisentan on R-and S-warfarin pharmacokinetics

claim text: Co-administration with steady-state ketoconazole significantly increased the plasma concentrations of a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg compared with rivaroxaban alone. The mean AUC increased by 82% (90% CI 59%, 108%) and the mean Cmax increased by 53% (90% CI 27%, 85%).
participants text: In the ketoconazole 200 mg study, 12 subjects were enrolled
drug1 dose text: In this open label, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg, alone or with ketoconazole (4 days of oral ketoconazole 200 mg once daily with rivaroxaban given on day 4)
drug2 dose text: In this open label, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg, alone or with ketoconazole (4 days of oral ketoconazole 200 mg once daily with rivaroxaban given on day 4).

participants text: In the ketoconazole 400 mg study, a total of 20 subjects were enrolled
drug1 dose text: This was a non-randomized, open label study in which subjects received oral rivaroxaban 10 mg once daily alone for 5 days, with concomitant ketoconazole 400 mg once daily for a further 5 days.
drug2 dose text: This was a non-randomized, open label study in which subjects received oral rivaroxaban 10 mg once daily alone for 5 days, with concomitant ketoconazole 400 mg once daily for a further 5 days.

claim text: Based on the ratio of the LS means, the mean Cmax and AUC0-∞ of amlodipine were increased 1.27-fold and 2.79-fold, respectively, by the coadministration of telaprevir (Table 1)
participants text: Twenty-one healthy male (n = 15) and female (n = 6) volunteers were enrolled at the Covance Clinical Research Unit, Inc., Daytona Beach, FL.
drug1 dose text: telaprevir in combination with Caduet tablets containing 5 mg of amlodipine and 20 mg of atorvastatin (amlodipine-atorvastatin). Volunteers received the following treatment: a single dose of amlodipine-atorvastatin alone on day 1, followed by a washout period,
drug2 dose text: Telaprevir (375-mg tablets, Patheon, Mississauga, Ontario, Canada) was administered at 750 mg q8h orally in the fed state (30 min after the start of a meal or snack).
auc text: Based on the ratio of the LS means, the mean Cmax and AUC0-∞ of amlodipine were increased 1.27-fold and 2.79-fold, respectively, by the coadministration of telaprevir (Table 1)
cmax text: Based on the ratio of the LS means, the mean Cmax and AUC0-∞ of amlodipine were increased 1.27-fold and 2.79-fold, respectively, by the coadministration of telaprevir (Table 1)
cl text: The mean t1/2 of amlodipine increased from 41.3 h to 95.1 h, and the mean apparent clearance (CL/F) decreased from 38.0 liters/h to 12.3 liters/h.
halflife text: The mean t1/2 of amlodipine increased from 41.3 h to 95.1 h, and the mean apparent clearance (CL/F) decreased from 38.0 liters/h to 12.3 liters/h.

Neither atorvastatin nor simvastatin appeared to alter the pharmacokinetics of nelfinavir.

drug1 dose text: In period 2, subjects received simvastatin (20 mg QD) plus nelfinavir (1,250 mg BID) for an additional 14 days (days 15 to 28).
drug2 dose text: In period 2, subjects received simvastatin (20 mg QD) plus nelfinavir (1,250 mg BID) for an additional 14 days (days 15 to 28).

claim text: Steady-state ritonavir significantly increased the AUC and Cmax of rivaroxaban. The mean AUC increased by 153% (90% CI 134%, 174%) and the mean Cmax increased by 55% (90% CI 41%, 69%) compared with rivaroxaban alone
participants text: Eighteen subjects were enrolled in the study.
drug1 dose text: Subjects received a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg on day 1, ritonavir 600 mg twice daily on days 3-7
drug2 dose text: Subjects received a single dose of rivaroxaban 10 mg on day 1, ritonavir 600 mg twice daily on days 3-7

claim text: Co-administration with fluconazole significantly increased the primary pharmacokinetic parameters of rivaroxaban (Table 2, Figure 1E). Both the mean AUC and mean Cmax increased (by 42% [90% CI 29%, 56%] and 28% [90% CI 12%, 47%], respectively) in comparison with rivaroxaban alone.
participants text: A total of 14 subjects were enrolled into the study, with a mean age of 33.8 years (range 24-53 years) and a mean weight of 83.7 ± 9.4 kg
drug1 dose text: In an open label, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg alone, or fluconazole 400 mg once daily given for 6 days, with a concomitant administration of 20 mg rivaroxaban given on day 5.
drug2 dose text: In an open label, two way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg alone, or fluconazole 400 mg once daily given for 6 days, with a concomitant administration of 20 mg rivaroxaban given on day 5

claim text: With TPV/r coadministration, the GM AUC for rosuvastatin was 38.6 ng·h/ml, a 37% increase compared with that of rosuvastatin alone (P = 0.0006) (Fig. ​(Fig.11 and ​and2).2).
participants text: Of the 29 subjects (5 women, 24 men), 16 evaluable subjects completed the study.
drug1 dose text: Subjects received a single 10-mg dose of rosuvastatin on day 1, followed by tipranavir 500 mg-ritonavir 200 mg twice daily for 11 days (days 3 to 13), with a single 10-mg dose of rosuvastatin given on day 12
drug2 dose text: Subjects received a single 10-mg dose of rosuvastatin on day 1, followed by tipranavir 500 mg-ritonavir 200 mg twice daily for 11 days (days 3 to 13), with a single 10-mg dose of rosuvastatin given on day 12
auc text: PK parameters of rosuvastatin alone or rosuvastatin plus TPV/ra
cmax text: PK parameters of rosuvastatin alone or rosuvastatin plus TPV/ra
cl text: PK parameters of rosuvastatin alone or rosuvastatin plus TPV/ra
halflife text: PK parameters of rosuvastatin alone or rosuvastatin plus TPV/ra

claim text: Co-administration with rivaroxaban slightly decreased the mean AUC of midazolam by 11% compared with midazolam alone, but this was not statistically significant (90% CI −25%, 5%). The mean Cmax was virtually unaffected. Conversely, the mean AUC of α-hydroxy-midazolam remained almost the same with co-administration of rivaroxaban and midazolam compared with midazolam alone, but the mean Cmax was increased by 11%. This change was not statistically significant (90% CI −23%, 59%).
participants text: A total of 12 subjects were enrolled.
drug1 dose text: In an open label, three way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg alone, a single dose of midazolam 7.5 mg alone or the combination.
drug2 dose text: In an open label, three way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg alone, a single dose of midazolam 7.5 mg alone or the combination.
auc text: Co-administration with rivaroxaban slightly decreased the mean AUC of midazolam by 11% compared with midazolam alone, but this was not statistically significant (90% CI −25%, 5%). The mean Cmax was virtually unaffected. Conversely, the mean AUC of α-hydroxy-midazolam remained almost the same with co-administration of rivaroxaban and midazolam compared with midazolam alone, but the mean Cmax was increased by 11%. This change was not statistically significant (90% CI −23%, 59%).
cmax text: Co-administration with rivaroxaban slightly decreased the mean AUC of midazolam by 11% compared with midazolam alone, but this was not statistically significant (90% CI −25%, 5%). The mean Cmax was virtually unaffected. Conversely, the mean AUC of α-hydroxy-midazolam remained almost the same with co-administration of rivaroxaban and midazolam compared with midazolam alone, but the mean Cmax was increased by 11%. This change was not statistically significant (90% CI −23%, 59%).
halflife text: The tmax and t1/2 of midazolam and its metabolite remained similar in the presence or absence of rivaroxaban.

claim text: Co-administration with midazolam led to an increase in rivaroxaban median tmax from 1.5 h to 4.0 h and slightly decreased the rivaroxaban mean Cmax by 12% compared with rivaroxaban alone, a change that was not statistically significant (90% CI −28%, 7%). Rivaroxaban mean AUC remained almost unchanged.
participants text: A total of 12 subjects were enrolled.

drug2 dose text: In an open label, three way crossover study, subjects were randomized to receive a single dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg alone, a single dose of midazolam 7.5 mg alone or the combination.
